mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, Mary Ball Washington to John A. Washington, c. 1785-86
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Washington, Mary Ball, 1708-1789
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Mary Washington to her son John Augustine Washington regarding her well-being. She writes that she feels quite ill, in fact close to death. In addition, she has had to borrow corn as she has none left and proclaims: "I never lived so pore in my life was it not for Mrs. French and your sister [Betty Washington] Lewis I should be almost starvd [.] but I am like an old almanack quit[e] out of date..." Autograph letter signed, 1 page, integral address panel; severely burned affecting five characters of four words of text, scorching more pronounced on address panel.
